findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 21 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act — including 0 critical and 21 high severity. Temporally verified against payment dates.

findings.label: Likely Duplicate Payments
findings.detail: 577 high-confidence duplicate groups with same supplier, amount, date and reference number

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 602 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week

findings.label: Round-Number Payments (>£5K)
findings.detail: 1486 exact round-number payments over £5,000 — may indicate estimates rather than invoiced amounts

findings.label: Year-End Spending Spike
findings.detail: Multiple departments spent 5.7x their monthly average in March — potential year-end budget rush worth £11.7M above normal

key_findings.title: Molesworth Hotel Ltd: £59.1K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: No active directors; No person with significant control registered

key_findings.title: Jml Property Solutions Ltd: £48.0K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Company facing strike-off; Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments

key_findings.title: A & C Weber Uk Ltd: £29.2K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments

key_findings.title: URBASER LTD: 959 transactions totalling £19.5M
key_findings.description: Averaging £20.3K per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier

key_findings.title: 39 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £100.3M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services

key_findings.title: WALTON SUMMIT TRUCK CENTRE LTD: 115237% price gap between councils
